alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Dakota; Ramsey; Scott; Washington (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 1:12AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dakota, southeastern Scott, southeastern Anoka, Washington and Ramsey Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 112 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of East Bethel to near Dundas. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ham Lake around 120 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hugo, Forest Lake, Chisago City and Scandia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 130 and 133. Interstate 35 between mile markers 79 and 80. U.S. Highway 8 in Minnesota between mile markers 0 and 3. U.S. Highway 61 near mile marker 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for east central Minnesota.
